titleStmt.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1823 Oct. 15 : a machine readable transcription of an image

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1823 Oct. 15
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This excerpt is from the Wednesday October 15 and Thursday October 15, 1823 sessions of court. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.head: Wednesday 15th
div.p: Court is convened agreeable to adjournment Present their Honors &c Jurors
In a case submitted to the Court yesterday

W. Burgess
vs
John Watts senr. senior
the Court gave it
as their opinion that John Watts should pay William Burgess sixty dollars.

Robert Vann
Ptf Plaintiff
vs
Joseph Crutchfield
Dft Defendant
a plea of debt

It is the opinion of the Court, that J Crutchfield shall Robert Vann $920. Reced. Received
24 of October 1823 Satisfied

Quatee (The Hairs sister Ctf
vs
Eligah Elijah HicksDft
a plea of debt
The Court give it as their opinion for the said Quatee, to Have the horse appraised and the said E. Hicks should pay agreeable to the appraisors appraiser's verdict

Tutteyee
Cpt Complainant
vs
Quatey Dft
On a plea of debt for a horse
It is the opinion of the Court for Quatey to return the horse to said Tutteyee or value thereof.
Court is adjourned untill until tomorrow 10 Oclock

div.head: Thursday 16th
div.p: Court convened agreeable to adjournment
Present their Honors Jurors &C D. Griffin Foreman

Samuel Carr Cpt
vs
Bushey Head Dft
On a plea of debt
It is the opinion of the Court that Bushey Head pay unto Samuel Carr sixty five dollars

Ken & Graham Ptf
vs
Arny Vann & W. Welch Deft
a plea of debt

The defendants being not ready for trial, it is refered referred to the district Court of
Chattoga Chattooga

James Foster Ptf
vs
Jessee Vann
Decd Admr. Deceased Administrator Deft
For a crime of grand Larciny Larceny
continued

Aggy Woffard Cpt
vs
Chulio (of Hight T) Dft
on a plea for damages
It is the opinion of the Court that Chulio shall diliver deliver up the contended farm, to A. Woffard by the 1st day of December next
Court is adjourned untill tomorrow 10 Oclock
